intro: Spermacoce dibrachiata, commonly known as the two-branched morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture, and its stems are often hairy as well. Spermacoce dibrachiata produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
